page.title: 10FARMING 2
page.content: MILL OAST FARM, JARVIS BROOK. This small 31 acre farm is owned and farmed by Mr & Mrs Bourne.The main crop is hay.Bullocks, pigs and sheep are reared and fed on hay, barley and concentrates.The crops and animals are sold at Haywards Heath Market.They own a tractor and hire a hay_maker. STEEL CROSS FARM SHOP This fruit farm, managed by Mr Thomson covers an area of 70 acres,60 of which are orchards.Fruit is sold 6 months after picking.Types of apples grown are Coxes, Bramley, Spartan, Melrose, Ida Red, Golden Delicious, Discovery and Russett.About 150_200 thousand cheap trees, but of good stock, are imported from Holland.They are about 4ft tall and spindly.Most apples are sold for eating, but some go into mak_ ing cider or animal feed.A number of people are employed part_time.
